cause.description:
In 1993, the World Health Organization declared tuberculosis to be a global health emergency. By 2015, the Global Plan to Stop TB aims to save 14 million lives.
Tuberculosis is an ancient and deadly disease caused primarily by mycobacterium tuberculosis. A relative of leprosy, this disease was the leading cause of death for centuries. Although the discovery of a fairly effective vaccine and antibiotics nearly defeated tuberculosis as a health threat, the rise in HIV in the 1980s created a perfect niche in which TB could thrive. Now, antibiotic-resistant strains of TB like MDR-TB (Multi-Drug Resistant Tuberculosis) and XDR-TB (Extensively Drug Resistant Tuberculosis) threaten the world's populace once again.
Don't wait for drug-resistant TB to visit your doorstep. Industrialized nations are no more invincible than Sub-Saharan Africa.
Tuberculosis was once the world's leading killer, and it's poised to make a comeback. Let's not let it.
References: http://www.who.int/tb/en/ http://www.lungusa.org/site/pp.asp?c=dvLUK9O0E&b=35778 http://www.niaid.nih.gov/factsheets/tb.htm http://www.umdnj.edu/globaltb/start.html http://www.cdc.gov/tb/default.htm
1. Extend TB treatment to areas previously inadequately cared for
2. Develop a new, more effective vaccine that could be given to all children
3. Research new anti-biotic and retroviral treatments for TB
4. Work toward the eradication of HIV in order to take away TB's most common victims
cause.mission: Eradicate tuberculosis and save lives through improved treatments, simpler diagnostic tests, new more effective vaccines, and more extensive world-wide care.
cause.name: STOP TB WORLDWIDE!
